title: Add detailed exercise schedule and comprehensive diet plan

requirements.text: Add seven specific exercises to the exercise library with complete details: Squats (Legs, 3 sets x 12 reps, description: 'Foundation for the entire body'), Push-ups (Chest/Shoulders/Triceps, 3 sets x max reps, description: 'Essential for every gym session'), Bench Press (Chest, 3 sets x 10 reps, description: 'Best exercise for broad chest'), Deadlift (Back/Overall Strength, 3 sets x 8 reps, description: 'Gives power to the entire body, focus on form'), Pull-ups/Lat Pulldown (Back/Biceps, 3 sets x 8-10 reps, description: 'Essential for V-shape body'), Overhead Press (Shoulders, 3 sets x 10 reps, description: 'For broader shoulders'), Plank (Core/Abs, 3 sets x 1 minute, description: 'Perform at the end of workout')

quotes: Squats (Legs): Puri body ka foundation hai. Start with 3 sets x 12 reps.
Push-ups (Chest/Shoulders/Triceps): Har gym session mein ise zaroor rakho. 3 sets x max reps.
Bench Press (Chest): Chest broad karne ke liye sabse best. 3 sets x 10 reps.
Deadlift (Back/Overall Strength): Ye poori body ko power deta hai. 3 sets x 8 reps (form par dhyan dena).
Pull-ups / Lat Pulldown (Back/Biceps): V-shape body ke liye zaruri hai. 3 sets x 8-10 reps.
Overhead Press (Shoulders): Kandhe chaudhe karne ke liye. 3 sets x 10 reps.
Plank (Core/Abs): Workout ke end mein 1 minute ke 3 sets.

acceptanceCriteria: All seven exercises are added to the exercise library with correct muscle groups
Each exercise includes the specified sets and reps information
Exercise descriptions are stored in the backend
Exercises are accessible through the exercise library interface

requirements.text: Create a comprehensive diet plan template with six meals (Breakfast, Mid-Morning, Lunch, Pre-Workout, Post-Workout, Dinner) where each meal has two food options: Breakfast Option 1: '3 Boiled Eggs + Brown Bread / Roti', Option 2: 'Oats with Milk + 1 Banana'; Mid-Morning Option 1: '1 bowl Roasted Chana (High Protein)', Option 2: 'Handful of Peanuts + 1 Apple'; Lunch Option 1: 'Dal + Rice + Curd (Dahi) + Salad', Option 2: 'Soya Chunks Curry + 2 Roti + Salad'; Pre-Workout Option 1: '1 Banana + Black Coffee (for energy)', Option 2: '1 Sweet Potato (Shakarkandi)'; Post-Workout Option 1: '4 Egg Whites or Paneer (50g)', Option 2: 'Sattu Drink (3-4 spoons in water/milk)'; Dinner Option 1: 'Paneer Bhurji / Chicken + 2 Roti', Option 2: 'Moong Dal Khichdi + Omelette'

quotes:
Meal Time What to Eat (Option 1) What to Eat (Option 2)
Breakfast 3 Boiled Eggs + Brown Bread / Roti Oats with Milk + 1 Banana
Mid-Morning 1 bowl Roasted Chana (Sasta & High Protein) Handful of Peanuts + 1 Apple
Lunch Dal + Rice + Curd (Dahi) + Salad Soya Chunks Curry + 2 Roti + Salad
Pre-Workout 1 Banana + Black Coffee (for energy) 1 Sweet Potato (Shakarkandi)
Post-Workout 4 Egg Whites or Paneer (50g) Sattu Drink (3-4 spoons in water/milk)
Dinner Paneer Bhurji / Chicken + 2 Roti Moong Dal Khichdi + Omelette

acceptanceCriteria: Diet plan template includes all six meal times
Each meal time has exactly two food options stored
All meal options match the specified Indian food items
Diet plan can be assigned to clients by trainers

requirements.text: Display the seven exercises (Squats, Push-ups, Bench Press, Deadlift, Pull-ups/Lat Pulldown, Overhead Press, Plank) with their sets, reps, and descriptions in the exercise library browser interface, organized by their target muscle groups
acceptanceCriteria: All seven exercises appear in the exercise library interface
Each exercise displays its sets and reps information
Exercises can be filtered by muscle group (Legs, Chest, Shoulders, Triceps, Back, Biceps, Core/Abs)
Exercise descriptions are visible to users

requirements.text: Display the comprehensive diet plan in the client dashboard diet plan view showing all six meal times (Breakfast, Mid-Morning, Lunch, Pre-Workout, Post-Workout, Dinner) with both food options clearly labeled as Option 1 and Option 2 for each meal
acceptanceCriteria: Diet plan view shows all six meal times in chronological order
Each meal displays both Option 1 and Option 2 food choices
Meal options match the specified Indian food items exactly
Diet plan is presented in an easy-to-read format for clients

constraints: Do not modify immutable frontend paths (useInternetIdentity.ts, useInternetIdentity.tsx, useActor.ts, main.tsx, components/ui)
Use existing exercise library data model and CRUD functions
Use existing diet plan data model and trainer assignment functions
nonGoals: Adding video URLs for the exercises
Calculating nutritional information (calories, macros) for diet plan meals
Modifying the weekly workout schedule template
Adding authentication or access control changes
